Sage Solar I, Sage Solar II, and Sage Solar III are collectively referred to herein as the “Co-Tenants” and individually as a “Co-Tenant”. The Co-Tenants are collectively referred to herein as the “Parties” and individually as a “Party.” RECITALS A. Pursuant to that certain Solar Energy Project Lease and Easement Agreement, dated August 17, 2018, between Sage Solar I and Argyles Ranch Inc., a Utah corporation (the “Property Owner”), a notice of which was recorded on September 5, 2018, as Filing No. 93701 in Book Z11 at Page 1108 in the Rich County Recorder’s Office (the “Recorder’s Office”), as amended by that certain Amendment to Solar Energy Project Lease and Easement Agreement, dated October 10, 2018, and recorded on November 1, 2018, in the Recorder’s Office as Filing No. 94032 in Book A12 at Page 545, and as further amended by that certain Second Amendment to Solar Energy Project Lease and Easement Agreement, dated March 6, 2019, and recorded on ___________, 2019, in the Recorder’s Office as Filing No. _______ in Book ____ at Page ________, Sage Solar I holds certain leasehold, right-of-way and easement interests in and to that certain land located in Rich County, Utah set forth on Annex I (the “Sage Solar I Property”), on which it intends to develop a solar energy generation project and certain related interconnection facilities (the “Sage Solar I Project”). B. Pursuant to that certain Solar Energy Project Lease and Easement Agreement, dated August 17, 2018, between Sage Solar II and Property Owner, a notice of which was recorded on September 5, 2018, in the Recorder’s Office as Filing No. 93702 in Book Z11 at Page 1115, as amended by that certain Amendment to Solar Energy Project Lease and Easement Agreement, dated October 10, 2018, and recorded on November 1, 2018, in the Recorder’s Office as Filing No. 94033 in Book A12 at Page 552, and as further amended by that certain Second Amendment to Solar Energy Project Lease and Easement Agreement, dated March 6, 2019, and recorded on ___________, 2019, in the Recorder’s Office as Filing No. _______ in Book ____ at Page ________, Sage Solar II holds certain leasehold, right-of-way and easement interests in and to that certain land located in Rich County, Utah set forth on Annex II (the “Sage Solar II Property”), on which it intends to develop a solar energy generation project and certain related interconnection facilities (the “Sage Solar II Project”). C. Pursuant to that certain Solar Energy Project Lease and Easement Agreement, dated August 17, 2018, between Sage Solar III and Property Owner, a notice of which was recorded on September 5, 2018, in the Recorder’s Office as Filing No. 93703 in Book Z11 at Page 1122, as amended by that certain Amendment to Solar Energy Project Lease and Easement Agreement, dated October 10, 2018, and recorded on November 1, 2018, in the Recorder’s Office as Filing No. 94034 in Book A12 at Page 560, and as further amended by that certain Second Amendment to Solar Energy Project Lease and Easement Agreement, dated March 6, 2019, and recorded on ___________, 2019, in the Recorder’s Office as Filing No. _______ in Book ____ at Page ________, Sage Solar III holds certain leasehold, right-of-way and easement interests in and to that certain land located in Rich County, Utah set forth on Annex III (the “Sage Solar III Property” and together with the Sage Solar I Property and the Sage Solar II Property, the “Properties” and each individually a “Property”), on which it intends to develop a solar energy generation project and certain related interconnection facilities (the “Sage Solar III Project” and together with the Sage Solar I Project and the Sage Solar II Project, the “Projects” and each individually a “Project”). D. Pursuant to (i) that certain Access Easement Agreement, dated August 23, 2018, by and between the Co-Tenants and EZ Land, LLC, a Utah limited liability company, recorded September 5, 2018 as Filing No. 93705 in Book Z11 at Page 1145 in the Recorder’s Office, as amended by that certain First Amendment to Access Easement Agreement, dated March 6, 2019, and recorded on ___________, 2019, in the Recorder’s Office as Filing No. _______ in Book ____ at Page ________; and (ii) that certain Access Easement Agreement, dated August 23, 2018, by and between the Co-Tenants and R&B Hay Sales, LLC, a Utah limited liability company, recorded September 5, 2018 as Filing No. 93704 in Book Z11 and Page 1129 in the Recorder’s Office, as amended by that certain First Amendment to Access Easement Agreement, dated March 6, 2019, and recorded on ___________, 2019, in the Recorder’s Office as Filing No. _______ in Book ____ at Page ________, each of Sage Solar I, Sage Solar II, and Sage Solar III holds certain easement interests in and to certain land located in Rich County, Utah (the “Access Easement Property”) on which the Co-Tenants intend to construct and use a common roadway allowing access to the Projects. E. Pursuant to an Engineering, Procurement and Construction Agreement, dated as of August 22, 2018, each of Sage Solar I, Sage Solar II and Sage Solar III has engaged RES America Construction Inc. to develop, design and construct certain shared facilities (the “Shared Facilities”) for the exclusive benefit, operation and use of the Projects on the Access Easement Property and certain “Shared Easement Areas” (as defined in each Co-Tenant’s lease agreement) located in Rich County, Utah, as each is set forth on Annex IV. F. Shared Facilities Manager will operate, maintain, repair, replace, and decommission the Shared Facilities for the exclusive benefit, operation and use of the Projects in accordance with that certain Co-Tenancy and Shared Facilities Agreement dated as of the Agreement Date by and among the Parties (the “Shared Facilities Agreement”). G. Pursuant to the Shared Facilities Agreement, the Parties have provided for: (i) the sharing of the use of such Shared Facilities necessary or convenient to each Co-Tenant’s ownership, development and operation of its respective Project; and (ii) sharing of the costs incurred pursuant to the development, design, construction and operation and maintenance of the Shared Facilities. H. By executing and recording this Memorandum, the Parties intend to provide constructive notice of the Shared Facilities Agreement, which will bind and benefit the Properties, and the Shared Facilities as provided in the Shared Facilities Agreement. NOW, THEREFORE, for good and valuable consideration, the Parties agree as follows: 1. Declaration of Intention. Shared Facilities Manager shall hold the Shared Facilities, but shall exercise such rights for the exclusive benefit of the Co-Tenants. Shared Facilities Manager shall hold and use the Shared Facilities solely for purposes of performing the Shared Facilities Services (as defined in the Shared Facilities Agreement). 2. Waiver of Right to Partition or Distribution. Each Party acknowledges and agrees that it would be prejudicial to the interests of the Parties under the Shared Facilities Agreement if any Party were to seek partition or any other type of division of the Shared Facilities or any other shared rights, assets or properties, or to file an action for such partition or division, or to seek to have or have Shared Facilities Manager distribute any interests in the Shared Facilities or any other shared rights, assets or properties to any of the Co-Tenants. Therefore, in consideration of such fact and for other good and valuable consideration, each of the Parties hereby waives and relinquishes any and all rights that it may have to seek a partition or any other type of division of, or distribution by Shared Facilities Manager of any rights or interests in the Shared Facilities or any other shared rights, assets or properties that are subject to the Shared Facilities Agreement. 3. Incorporation; Conflicts. The terms and conditions of the Shared Facilities Agreement are incorporated herein by reference. In the event of any conflict between the provisions of the Shared Facilities Agreement and the provisions of this Memorandum, the Shared Facilities Agreement shall control.
